DATA:
Point the mouse to each requirement of the experiment to know the name / Click the "Continue" button to start the experiment.
Pour some TLC solvent in a measuring flask(Cover the flask containing the solvent with aluminium foil to avoid evaporation of the solvent.)
Pour the solvent into the TLC chamber.
Close the chamber to avoid evaporation.
Take a TLC Plate with a line drawn at the bottom of the plate. (Make sure the line is drawn with pencil.)
Take a capillary tube.
Dip the capillary tube into the beaker containing the amino acid 'Tryptophan'.
Spot the amino acid on the line drawn on the TLC plate using capillary tube (care should be taken to avoid spreading of the spot.)
Dry the spot using blow dryer. Repeat the same for the three other amino acids, "Glycine", "Tyrosine" and the "Unknown Mixture".
Take the TLC plate.
Now put the plate into the TLC chamber containing TLC solvent as shown. (Make sure the TLC plate is not dipped completely.)
Close the TLC chamber.
Allow the solvent to rise until about 1 cm from the top of the plate.
Now take out the plate.
Allow the plate to dry and mark the solvent front using pencil after taking out the plate from the TLC chamber.
Take the reagent spray bottle.
Remove the cap of the bottle.
Pour the Ninhydrin reagent into the reagent spray bottle.
Replace the top of the spray bottle.
Spray the Ninhydrin on the plate as shown.
///////////
After spraying, keep the TLC plate in oven for 5 minutes 105°C to devolope the plate.
After some time, we can observe that coloured spots appear on the plate at different distances.
